trans-unit.source: Represents a security token that is based upon a user name and password.
Use <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> class to provide authentication credentials in the form of a user name and password.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified user name and password.
A user name.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.UserName"></xref> property.
A password for the user name.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.Password"></xref> property.
userName is `null`.
-or-
password is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified user name, password, and unique identifier.
A user name.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.UserName"></xref> property.
A password for the user name.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.Password"></xref> property.
A unique identifier of the security token.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.Id"></xref> property.
userName is `null`.
-or-
password is `null`.
-or-
id is `null`.
Gets a unique identifier of the security token.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.Id%2A> property is usually in the format of a URI with a GUID.
A unique identifier of the security token.
Gets the password for the user name associated with the security token.
The password for the user name associated with the security token.
Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.

<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> security tokens cannot be used for cryptographic operations, by default, so the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.SecurityKeys%2A> property returns an empty collection.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.
Gets the user name that is associated with the security token.
The user name that is associated with the security token.
Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> token is valid.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.
Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> token is valid.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
